info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:25PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Lewis and Clark, northwestern Meagher and southwestern Cascade Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 525 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles east of Wolf Creek, or 17 miles south of Cascade, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Lewis and Clark, northwestern Meagher and southwestern Cascade Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
